instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has short to ground. Here is a picture explained where the short begins around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: Inject low voltage 1-2V on 3V42 bus with external power supply and see what component heats up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: Thanks duke! To what component i inject it and what about Amps?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: Never mind. I checked Rossmans Video on youtube. It started working and chimed after i got the short out. I could not find the short but it just started working after the short went away. Anyways after i connected the connectors to logic board it still was working fine until i plugged the battery. It chargers but docent start anymore... What should i check now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: Sometimes the fan starts to spin and sometimes it dosen't. And also the green light goes off when i move it little bit. Its not the charger because its new one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message:
Perhaps corrosion you can't see on pin 8 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>?

More history needed!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: This logic board was water damaged. And yes pin 8 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> has corrosion...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: I replaced the <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> with a new one. Cleaned the area before soldering the new one. Now the device works just fine without any problems. I have question that how did you know that there could be corrosion? And thanks louis!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: Because all this shit has the same corrosion on the same points. I can also tell you that there is a very good chance the short on 3V42 will return.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: Thanks! Well then i have to find where the short was. I couldn't find it after it went away...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message:
because when you spend 3 hours looking for it and find it you never forget. [URL]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ON2dWlYUQA[/URL]

Sunny's catchphrase is "just jump it", but you shouldn't jump it.. but I jumped it for him, cause he couldn't wait:)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short to ground around <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.
threads.message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] The short came back as you said. Can you tell me what i can do now?
